jhelp.util.thread

Class ThreadedTask<PARAMETER,RESULT,PROGRESS>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jhelp.util.thread.ThreadedTask<PARAMETER,RESULT,PROGRESS>
  • Type Parameters:
    PARAMETER - Parameter type
    RESULT - Result type
    PROGRESS - Progression type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PostProgress, PreferencesSerializer, ThreadedSimpleTask

    public abstract class ThreadedTask<PARAMETER,RESULT,PROGRESS>
extends java.lang.Object
    Task do in separate thread
    Extends this class to have a good thread manager with ThreadManager.
    Its better to use this mechanism than create a new Thread instance and haven't issue noticed in "Scheduled mechanism" to know more see ThreadManager.
    This class is the complete version, it have a parameter, a result and a progress information.
    Parameter It is given when this task turn arrive (One time or by repetition) It allows to have only one instance that react to different parameters in different threads
    Result It is is computed by the implementation of the derived class. When the result is computed this class is alerted.
    Progress During the computing, you can signal a progression to for example update a progress bar The progression information is up to implementation and it signal in separate thread, so when received the progression information it is not the exact progression. We have do this choice to not slow down the computation by showing progression
    Author:
    JHelp
